page.title: 17HAILEY AREA - EAST
page.content: {SQUARE 3710 {SCIENCE & TECHNOLOGY}:10 Hectares (10% of the area) are taken up by the Lea Valley Experimental Horticultural Station, started 28 yrs ago. A large proportion of the area is under glass- houses, grazing or wooded.{HOUSING: Next to the Research Station is a community support home for the handicapped, built by the East Herts. Health Authority. The Roseland and Hundred Acre Housing estates provide residences and{AMENITIES.}Each is almost self-sufficient; providing schools, playing fields & playgrounds. There are also a few 'mini- markets' scattered through the estates, but the high car/person ratio and easy road access to the local towns of Hoddesdon & Hertford mean that many people shop there and also in London which is only 20kms away via the A10.
